projects.title: Fine Sediment and River Dynamics (COFUND Marie Curie EU-FP7-606838)
projects.description:
The project aims to study the dynamics of rivers governed by fine sediment processes defining and testing methods to forecast their long-term morphological evolution for applications in water resource management, river ecology, river restoration and flood risk assessments. A specific focus is devoted to the Mara Wetland, Tanzania.
This project receives funding from the European Union’s Seventh Framework Programme for research, technological development and demonstration under grant agreement no 606838 (co-financed by IHE Delft and Marie Curie Programme)

projects.title: Debris Flow (Agreement: CGL 2009-13039)
projects.description:
Project led by Prof. Allen Bateman and funded by Spanish Ministry of Science and innovation.
Experimental works on debris flows, landslide tsunamis and river morpho-dynamics.

contributors.headline: Ph.D., Lecturer and Researcher on Hydraulic and Environmental Engineering

projects.title: Improving Preparedness and Risk management for flash floods and debris flow events, IMPRINTS (FP7-ENV-2008-1-226555)
projects.description:
Project led by Prof. Daniel Sempere Torres and funded by the European Community. Consortium of European universities and basin authorities.
Duties: create tools to assess and map the risk associated to landslides, debris flows and flash flood hazards. The tools were created in Java, extensively using Geographic Information System (GIS) techniques.

company.name: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: Coordinator of the River Morphodynamics course of the MSc in Water and Sustainable Development; carry on research on sediment and pollutants transport in freshwater and on river morphodynamics including the effects of human activities and climate change.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer and Researcher

profile_positions.description: Modelling the fate of contaminants of emerging concern from urban and rural sources into fresh water from local to global scale in national (the Netherlands) and European research projects; teaching the Geographic Information Systems (GIS) course.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.company: IHE Delft Institute for Water Education
profile_positions.description: COFUND - MARIE CURIE postdoc in dynamics of rivers governed by fine sediment processes defining and testing methods to forecast their long-term morphological evolution for applications in water resource management, river ecology, river restoration and flood risk assessments. I devoted a specific focus to the case study of the Mara Wetland, Tanzania, where I performed multidisciplinary field works employing UAV, sonar, ADCP and other tools to obtain new data of morphology, hydrology and river hydraulics in remote areas.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: Modelling the fate of contaminants of emerging concern in river networks at global scale, using programming GIS tools and including scenarios of global changes; meta-analysis of effects of human-driven water stress on river ecosystems under water scarcity.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Topics: development of numerical tools for landslides, debris flows and flash flood hazard and risk assessment; experimental works on tsunamis provoked by rapid landslides and debris flows; experimental works on natural hazard mitigation. 
PhD funded by the Spanish Ministry of Education (FPU2009 fellowship) and led by Prof. Allen Bateman.
Teaching assistance in Debris Flow Risk Assessment Tools (Flood Risk Management, Master Erasmus-Mundus, organized by UNESCO-IHE); teaching assistance in hydraulic construction and hydraulic laboratory (Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya).
Supervision of Msc and Bsc thesis.
Participation in R&D&I projects funded in competitive calls.
Engineering and research consultancy on projects related to dam safety spillways, hydraulic structures, river sediment transport.
Field survey of disastrous events of floods, debris flows and landslides.
Participation and presentation of works in international congresses.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: Training period of 3 months funded by the Spanish Ministry of Education, working on the PhD thesis in experimental works on tsunamis provoked by fast granular landslides. Hosted by Prof. Hermann Fritz in the School of Civil and Environmental Engineering.
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description: Projects' elaboration in hydraulic and environmental engineering works: waste-water re-utilization, river restoration, water pipes, coastal preservation, irrigation; tasks of safety controls in constructions sites.
profile_positions.title: Engineer consultant

profile_positions.description:
MSc thesis in laboratory experiments on river morpho-dynamic. The internship has been conducted in the laboratories of the Sediment Transport Research Group (GITS) led by Prof. Allen Bateman of the Hydraulic Engineering department.
The thesis title was: "Messa a punto di un’ apparecchiatura sperimentale e prove preliminari per lo studio della morfodinamica di alvei in ghiaia"
profile_positions.title: Internship

profile_positions.description: Evaluation of the hydro-biological quality of rivers; support in planning and management of basins; support in detention basins’ construction and survey, maintenance of bridges and river banks; field survey
profile_positions.title: Engineering Trainee
